Body: I have a rooted Samsung Galaxy Grand Prime (SM-G530H) running Android 4.4.4.I would like to gain more memory space on device. I can only disable not necessary (for me) stock apps, but nothing changes in device memory.Is there a possibility to completely remove them? E.g. Drive, Maps (because I have Google Earth), Hangouts, and others, I would like to delete them eternally.
Title: How to delete an stock app in Samsung Galaxy Grand Prime?

history.Text: I have a rooted samsung galaxy grand prime (Model number: SM-G530H) and (Android version 4.4.4)...I would like to gain more memory space on device memory... I can only disable not necessary (for me) stock app... but nothing changes in device memory... Is there a possibility to do that... e.g. Drive, Maps (because I have Google Earth), Hangouts etc... I would to delete them eternally..And my greetings to all :)
How to delete an stock app (not only disable) on android samsung galaxy grand prime?
